content:
Diagnosis:		Papillary thyroid carcinoma

Management:		Total thyroidectomy March 2023
		Radioactive iodine ablation May 2023

Histology:		pT1N0M0 papillary thyroid carcinoma
		BRAF V600E mutation positive

Current situation:	Routine surveillance review

[redacted name] attended for routine follow-up today. She remains well with no concerning symptoms. Her TSH is well-suppressed at 0.1 and thyroglobulin remains undetectable (<0.1). Neck examination shows well-healed thyroidectomy scar with no palpable abnormalities. Recent ultrasound neck (15/4/24) shows no evidence of recurrence. Tolerating levothyroxine 150mcg daily with no side effects. Plan to continue current management with next review in 6 months with thyroglobulin measurement and TSH check. Will arrange repeat ultrasound neck for 12 months' time.

cancer_timeline.value: TSH well-suppressed at 0.1 and thyroglobulin undetectable (<0.1)
Ultrasound neck shows no evidence of recurrence

patient_facts.value: Well-healed thyroidectomy scar with no palpable abnormalities

status_updates.value: Early stage papillary thyroid cancer post thyroidectomy and radioiodine. Disease-free on surveillance with suppressed TSH.
Continuing levothyroxine 150mcg daily with good tolerance
Review in 6 months with thyroglobulin and TSH check
